headline: CEO Mary Barra shares three leadership rules from 40 years at General Motors
summary: After four decades at GM, CEO Mary Barra says her biggest lessons are simple: do the right thing even when it's tough, fix problems the moment you see them, be transparent, and stay relentlessly focused on the customer because they're the ones who ultimately decide if you're winning. Catch Mary Barra's full interview on CNBC Leaders Playbook — all-new episodes Wednesdays at 10p ET/PT.

headline: GM CEO Mary Barra asks herself one question before every big decision
summary: General Motors CEO Barra says the biggest risk a leader can take isn't one bold move — it's failing to plan for where the industry is headed. Her leadership approach: start with a long-term vision, make the right calls today, stay flexible as new info comes in, and constantly "de-risk" the strategy so GM can win for decades. Catch Mary Barra's full interview on CNBC Leaders Playbook — all-new episodes Wednesdays at 10p ET/PT.

headline: GM CEO Mary Barra on the future of EVs: Stop debating 'when' – just start building
summary: GM CEO Mary Barra says the company set its 2035 all-EV goal to stop arguing about when the shift would happen and start focusing on making great cars. But she's also clear they'll stay flexible — following what customers actually want and continuing to improve the battery tech as they go. headline: US applications for jobless benefits inch up last week to a still-low 200,000
summary: The number of Americans who applied for unemployment benefits inched up last week but U.S. layoffs remain historically low despite signs of a softening labor market.  U.S. filings for jobless aid for the week ending Jan. 17 rose by 1,000 to 200,000, up from 199,000 the previous week, the Labor Department reported Thursday.  Applications for unemployment benefits are viewed as a proxy for layoffs and are close to a real-time indicator of the health of the job market.
